pddl4j.exp
Interface Exp

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
InitEl, Literal, Term
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractExp, AbstractTerm, AlwaysExp, AlwaysWithinExp, AndExp, Assign, AssignOpExp, AtEndTimedExp, AtMostOnceExp, AtomicFormula, AtStartTimedExp, AtTimedExp, BinaryAdd, BinaryCondExp, BinaryDivide, BinaryMultiply, BinaryOp, BinarySubstract, CondExp, Constant, Decrease, DerivedPredicate, EqualComp, ExistsExp, FCompExp, FExp, FHead, ForallExp, GEqualComp, GreaterComp, HoldAfterExp, HoldDuringExp, ImplyExp, Increase, LEqualComp, LessComp, ListExp, MaximizeExp, MetricExp, MinimizeExp, NArityAdd, NArityMultiply, NArityOp, NotAtomicFormula, NotExp, Number, OpExp, OrExp, OverAllTimedExp, OverTimedExp, PrefExp, QuantifiedExp, ScaleDown, ScaleUp, SometimeAfterExp, SometimeBeforeExp, SometimeExp, TimedExp, TimedLiteral, UnaryCondExp, Variable, WhenExp, WithinExp
public interface Exp
extends java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

This interface is implemented by all expression of the PDDL language.

standardize

Exp standardize()
Standardizes all occurrences of the variables that occur in this expression. Remember that free variables are existentially quantified.

Returns:
a standardized copy of this expression.

standardize

Exp standardize(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> images)
Standardizes all occurrences of the variables that occur in this expression. The map argument is used to store the variable already standardized. Remember that free variables are existentially quantified.

Parameters:
images - the object that maps old variable images to the standardize image.
Returns:
a standardized copy of this expression.

toTypedString

java.lang.String toTypedString()
Returns a typed string of this expression.

Returns:
a typed string of this expression.

clone

Exp clone()
Returns a deep copy of this expression. Creates and returns a copy of this expression. The precise meaning of "copy" is as follow: 
 x.clone() != x
will be true, and that the expression: 
 x.clone().getClass() == x.getClass()
will be true. While it is the case that: 
 x.clone().equals(x)
will be true. Finally, note that except type of term expression are deeply copy.

Returns:
a deep copy of this expression.
See Also:
Cloneable

toPrenexNormaForm

Exp toPrenexNormaForm()
Returns the prenex normal form of this expression. Note, the expression returned is a copy. The expression is first standardized and it is placed in the prenex normal form by recursively moving quantifier inward with the existential quantifier first using the following rewriting rules (which are in fact equivalences):
  • (and (forall (x) A) B) => (forall (x) (and A B))
  • (or (forall (x) A) B) => (forall (x) (or A B))
  • (and (exists (x) A) B) => (exists (x) (and A B))
  • (or (exists (x) A) B) => (exists (x) (or A B))
  • (not (exists (x) (A))) => (forall (x) (not A))
  • (not (forall (x) (A))) => (exists (x) (not A))
  • (imply A (forall (x) (B))) => (forall (x) (imply A B))
  • (imply A (exists (x) (B))) => (exists (x) (imply A B))
  • (imply (forall (x) (A)) B) => (exists (x) (imply A B))
  • (imply (exists (x) (A)) B) => (forall (x) (imply A B))

Returns:
the prenex normal form of this expression.

moveQuantifierOutward

Exp moveQuantifierOutward()
Returns a copy of this expression such that the quantifiers appear first and in which all existential quantifiers precede all universal quantifiers

Returns:
a copy of this expression such that the quantifiers appear first.

toDisjunctiveNormalForm

Exp toDisjunctiveNormalForm()
Returns the disjunctive normal form of this expression. Note, the expression returned is a copy. The expression is first converted into negative normal form and it is placed in the disjunctive normal form by recursively moving conjunctions inward and disjunctions outward using the following rewriting rules (which are in fact equivalences):
  • (and A (or B C)) => (or (and A B) (and A C))
  • (and (or A B) C)) => (or (and A C) (and B C))

Returns:
the disjunctive normal form of this expression.

toConjunctiveNormalForm

Exp toConjunctiveNormalForm()
Returns the conjunctive normal form of this expression. Note, the expression returned is a copy. The expression is first converted into negative normal form and it is placed in the conjunctive normal form by recursively moving disjunction inward and conjunction outward using the following rewriting rules (which are in fact equivalences):
  • (or A (and B C)) => (and (or A B) (or A C))
  • (or (and A B) C)) => (and (or A C) (or B C))

Returns:
the disjunctive normal form of this expression.

toNegativeNormalForm

Exp toNegativeNormalForm()
Returns the negative normal form of this expression. Note, the expression returned is a copy. The negative normal form is obtained by recursively replace formulas appearing on the left with formulas appearing on the right:
  • (imply A B) => (or (not A) B)
  • (not (not F)) => F
  • (not (or A B)) => (and (not A) (not B))
  • (not (and A B)) => (or (not A) (not B))
  • (not (imply A B)) => (and A (not B))
  • (not (exists (x) (F))) => (forall (x) (not F))
  • (not (forall (x) (F))) => (exists (x) (not F))
  • default a copy of the expression where inner expressions are in negative normal form

    • Returns:
    the negative normal form of this expression.

getFreeVariables

java.util.Set<Variable> getFreeVariables()
Returns the set of free variables of this expression.

Returns:
the set of free variables of this expression.
